1:
Yahweh my God, I take refuge in you!
\q Save me from all who chase me, and rescue me.
\q
2:
Otherwise, they will rip me apart like a lion,
\q tearing me in pieces with no one else able to bring me to safety.
4:
I have never done wrong to anyone at peace with me,
\q or senselessly harmed any who are against me.
5:
If I am not telling the truth then let my enemy pursue my life and overtake it;
\q let him trample my living body on the ground
\q and leave me lying dishonored in the dust.
\qs Selah\qs*
7:
The countries are assembled all around you;
\q take once more your rightful place over them.
9:
May the evil deeds of the wicked come to an end, but establish the righteous people,
\q righteous God, you who examine hearts and minds.
10:
My shield comes from God,
\q the one who saves the upright in heart.
\q
11:
God is a righteous judge,
\q a God who is indignant each day.
12:
If a person does not repent, God will sharpen his sword
\q and will prepare his bow for battle.
\q
13:
He prepares to use weapons against him;
\q he makes his arrows flaming shafts.
14:
Think about the one who is pregnant with wickedness,
\q who conceives destructive plans, who gives birth to harmful lies.
\q
15:
He digs a pit and hollows it out
\q and then falls into the hole he has made.
\q
16:
His own destructive plans return to his own head,
\q for his violence comes down on his own head.

 
\q
17:
I will give thanks to Yahweh for his justice;
\q I will sing praise to Yahweh Most High.
